intro: Actephila longipedicellata, commonly known as the long-stemmed actephila, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers, which are typically arranged in cymes. Actephila longipedicellata is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forests and undergrowth. Its botanical features make it a notable species for ecological studies and horticultural interest.
